description: [ISS] If they are imposed, Trump's blizzard of 'reciprocal' tariffs will hit AGOA beneficiaries more than most.
title: Africa: Could Africa Still Be Hard Hit By Trump's Tariff Tantrum?

description: [Vanguard] Gen. Sahir Mirza, Chairman, Joint Chiefs of Staff Committee, Islamic Republic of Pakistan, has described Nigeria as a regional power and a pillar of stability on the African continent.
title: Africa: Nigeria Regional Power, Pillar of Stability in Africa, Says Pakistani Military Chief

description: [The Conversation] The Fulani people are Africa's largest pastoralist group . There are between 25 million and 40  million Fulani people across 17 African countries , from the Atlantic shores of Senegal and Mauritania to Sudan.
title: Africa: Fulani - New Study Unravels The Genetic History of Africa's Largest Pastoralist Community

description: [RFI] African exporters have welcomed a temporary reprieve from new US tariffs, after President Donald Trump suspended a planned 30 percent import tax for 90 days - but the bigger picture remains uncertain.
title: Africa: Despite Pause On U.S. Tariffs, African Economies Face Uncertain Future

description: [Africa CDC] With external health aid to Africa expected to plunge by 70% between 2021 and 2025, the Africa Centres for Disease Control and Prevention (Africa CDC) has launched a continent-wide strategy to radically transform how health systems are financed, putting African resources at the centre of African health.
title: Africa: Africa CDC Unveils Strategic Plan to Transform Health Financing and Advance Self-Reliance

description: [IPS] United Nations -- As the Trump administration's hostility towards the United Nations and other international organizations keeps growing, a New York Times columnist last week proposed what he frivolously described as "something a little incendiary".
title: Africa: U.S. Tariffs Threaten to Undermine World Trade Organization

description: [IPS] Brussels, Belgium -- Europe must understand that the only reasonable and humane way to tackle migrant smuggling is to open regular routes for people to reach Europe in safety and dignity.
title: Africa: Migrant Smuggling - Europe Must Make a U-Turn

description: [Africa CDC] Africa's top public health institution is planning to tap more funds from domestic sources to protect the gains made over the past two decades in epidemic preparedness and response, following a steep decline in external support.
title: Africa: Africa's Plan to Fill Health Funding Gaps Amidst Declining Coffers

description: [Africa CDC] The movement of African health professionals away from their home countries, predominantly towards higher-income nations is a critical challenge to the sustainability and resilience of African health systems. The loss of skilled personnel is worsening workforce shortages, undermining healthcare delivery capacity, and impeding progress towards achieving Universal Health Coverage (UHC) and the African Union's Agenda 2063.
title: Africa: Health Workforce Plight in Africa

description: [allAfrica] Tanzania Opposition Leader Lissu Charged With Treason
title: Africa: All of Africa Today - April 11, 2025

description: [This Day] President Bola Tinubu, yesterday hailed Afreximbank's role in shaping Africa's trade landscape, and commitment to breaking down barriers, bridging financing gaps as well as empowering African businesses to compete globally.
title: Africa: Tinubu Hails Afreximbank's Role in Breaking Africa's Trade, Financing Barriers

description: [Premium Times] He, however, said that challenges persisted in active case search, contact tracing, and follow-up, especially within sexual networks driving the outbreak
title: Africa: Africa CDC Raises Concern Over Triple Health Threat

description: [Africa CDC] The Moroccan consortium, led by Institut Pasteur du Maroc, was appointed co-host of Africa CDC's North Africa Regional Capacity and Capability Network (RCCN) to advance regional vaccine innovation and sustainable biomanufacturing training across the African continent. Here's how they are helping build the continent's vaccine future.
title: Africa: Getting to Know the Regional Capacity and Capability Network for North Africa

description: [UN News] As governments and global markets struggle to deal with the deep concerns and disruptions caused by trade tariffs, Rebeca Grynspan, the head of the UN trade and development agency (UNCTAD), told UN News on Thursday that the poorest countries - whose activities have a negligible effect on trade deficits - should be exempt.
title: Africa: Spare Developing Countries From New U.S. Tariffs - UN Trade Chief

description: [UN News] Recent funding cuts have caused "severe disruptions" to health services in almost three-quarters of all countries, according to the head of the UN World Health Organization (WHO), Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus.
title: Africa: WHO Warns of Severe Disruptions to Health Services Amid Funding Cuts

description: [The Conversation Africa] The Fulani people are Africa's largest pastoralist group. There are between 25 million and 40 million Fulani people across 17 African countries, from the Atlantic shores of Senegal and Mauritania to Sudan.
title: Africa: New Study Unravels the Genetic History of Africa's Largest Pastoralist Fulani Community

description: [IPS] Nairobi -- "To have impact, it was crucial to understand what impact was wanted," CGIAR's Executive Managing Director Dr. Ismahane Elouafi said at the launch of the organization's flagship report, Insight to Impact: A decision-maker's guide to navigating food system science.
title: Africa: Insight to Impact - CGIAR Inaugural Flagship Report for Decision Makers Navigating Food System Science

description: [The Conversation Africa] Voters in Gabon head to the ballot box on April 12, 2025, in a vote that marks the first election in the Central African nation since a 2023 coup ended the 56-year rule of the Bongo family.
title: Africa: Will Africa's Young Voters Continue to Punish Incumbents At the Ballot Box in 2025?

description: [IPS] Nairobi -- As agrifood systems in the Global South buckle under the weight of climate change, biodiversity, and even pollution, experts such as Dr. Himanshu Pathak call for urgent innovative solutions, as, at the current pace, the problems of the Global South are going to intensify with escalating climate change.
title: Africa: 'Act Before It Gets Worse' - Experts Warn As Agrifood Problems in Global South Intensify

description: [IPS] Nairobi -- Increasingly, experts in the global health and agricultural sectors are finding the One Health approach effective for identifying and addressing health concerns that can influence facets of health. Implementing this approach worldwide will require partnerships across different sectors.
title: Africa: Strengthening One Health Approach in Agriculture Requires Cross-Sectoral Partnerships, Information

description: [UN News] Millions of deaths could be avoided from meningitis if countries are able to adopt new guidelines designed to diagnose and treat the disease more effectively, the UN World Health Organization (WHO) said on Thursday.
title: Africa: Preventable 'Meningitis Belt' Deaths Targeted in Health Agency Action Plan

description: [IPS] Nairobi -- Women farmers face structural issues that prevent them from realizing their full potential, from societal perceptions that dictate their limitations to poor land.
title: Africa: CGIAR Gender Impact Platform Needs a 'Bold Approach' in Agriculture Research

description: [IPS] Nairobi -- Animal scientist Lindiwe Majele Sibanda became what her grandmother earnestly prayed for she was growing up on a farm in southern Zimbabwe.
title: Africa: 'With Science, We Can Feed the World of 9.7 Billion By 2050'

description: [ISS] Instability, enforcement gaps and poverty combine to enable the rampant trafficking of cheetah cubs to the Middle East.
title: Africa: Trafficking Is Decimating the Horn's Cheetah Population
